title: Designing Effective Language-Integrated Pedagogy in Online Mathematics Learning Environments: A Simulation-Based Case Study

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge and extensive practical experience in the field, as well as linguistic proficiency in explaining mathematical concepts and problem-solving processes
context.additional_context: A simulation-based experience for pre-service and in-service teachers to engage with interaction, assessment, and technology integration in online math education environments, applying linguistic expression of mathematical concepts, error analysis, and feedback strategies to real-world cases

learning_goals: Learners will explain at least three strategies for concept explanation, problem-solving processes, and mathematical reasoning construction using technological tools in online mathematics environments.
Learners will design teaching-learning interactions using mathematical representations (symbols, graphs, diagrams) by applying simulation/VR-based communication techniques.
Learners will develop a learner feedback system using formative assessment-centered online evaluation tools, applying mathematical error analysis and linguistic feedback strategies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
